text: Castanopsis buruana is a tree in the family Fagaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin, meaning "of Buru" (one of Indonesia's Maluku Islands). ==Description== Castanopsis buruana grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The brown bark is smooth or scaly. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its ovoid to roundish nuts measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Castanopsis buruana grows naturally in Borneo, Sulawesi and Maluku. Its habitat is dipterocarp forests from sea-level to altitude. ==References== buruana Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Trees of Sulawesi Category:Trees of the Maluku Islands Category:Plants described in 1863 Category:Taxa named by Friedrich Anton Wilhelm Miquel
title: Castanopsis buruana
